content: This is machine learning for math rather than machine learning for theorem proving, but I imagine the readership of this stream will be well-informed: what are the best tools currently available for the task of converting an image of handwritten text to LaTeX? Is there a way to create a pipeline in which a first approximation is compiled to DVI/PDF and then compared optically with the original image for feedback and adjustment?
I have used https://mathpix.com/image-to-latex in the past, worked fairly well.
Definitely saves a bunch of time even though it might not get it right 100% of the time.
Interesting, I'll try it. Is there anything public about how it works?
Not sure, didn't look into it but others here may know more.
There is also this open source project: pix2tex. It's a vision transformer trained on wikipedia, arxiv, and the im2latex-100k dataset.
